snippet: Israel’s social justice movement struggled to respond after a protester, Moshe Silman, set himself on fire at one of the largest protests in the country’s history on Saturday.
abstract: Israel’s social justice movement struggles to respond after activist Moshe Silman sets himself on fire; some see desperate act as reaffirmation of the relevancy of grass-roots struggle that had seemed to be floundering; at peak of 2011 rallies, at least 400,000 Israelis peacefully took to the streets in one of the largest protests in nation’s history; efforts to revive those heady days have been met with a degree of public apathy.
lead_paragraph: Israel’s social justice movement struggled to respond after a protester, Moshe Silman, set himself on fire at one of the largest protests in the country’s history on Saturday.

headline.main: Israeli’s Act of Despair Disheartens a Movement
headline.print_headline: Israeli’s Act Of Despair Disheartens A Movement
